sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Musæus, on the loves of Hero and Leander with annotations upon the originall. / By Sir Robert Stapylton Knight, gentleman of the Privie Chamber to the Prince. Hero and Leander. English. Musaeus, Grammaticus. Stapylton, Robert, Sir, d. 1669. Marshall, William, fl. 1617-1650, engraver. Ovid, 43 B.C.-17 or 18 A.D.
[144] p.
Printed by F.B. for Humphrey Mosley, and are to be sold at his Shop at the Princes Armes in Saint Pauls Church Yard, London : 1647.
The words "Hero and Leander:" are bracketed together on title page. With an additional title page, engraved, signed: W Marshall sculp. Signatures: pi¹ A-F¹² (-F12). The first leaf bears verses on the frontispiece. "Leander's letter to Hero, and her ansvver: taken out of Ovid" has separate dated title page; register is continuous. F11 is in two settings: with errata on (1) recto or (2) verso. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
Musæus, on the loves of Hero and Leander with annotations upon the originall. / By Sir Robert Stapylton Knight, gentleman of the Privie Chamber to the Prince. Hero and Leander. English. Musaeus, Grammaticus. Stapylton, Robert, Sir, d. 1669. Marshall, William, fl. 1617-1650, engraver. Ovid, 43 B.C.-17 or 18 A.D.
[144] p.
Printed by F.B. for Humphrey Mosley, and are to be sold at his Shop at the Princes Armes in Saint Pauls Church Yard, London : 1647.
The words "Hero and Leander:" are bracketed together on title page. With an additional title page, engraved, signed: W Marshall sculp. Signatures: pi¹ A-F¹² (-F12). The first leaf bears verses on the frontispiece. "Leander's letter to Hero, and her ansvver: taken out of Ovid" has separate dated title page; register is continuous. F11 is in two settings: with errata on (1) recto or (2) verso. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
Humphrey Mosley
F.B.
his Shop at the Princes Armes in Saint Pauls Church Yard
